description: Enduring loathing: a steady, deliberate refusal of goodwill. The feeling isn’t a flare-up—it’s a settled stance, attention held on what disgusts or threatens the self, with a quiet certainty that the other should be kept out, diminished, or gone.
actor_description: It isn’t heat—it’s clarity. My jaw sets and my mind goes still, like something in me has closed a door and thrown the bolt. I can think calmly about how to cut them out, how to deny them space, how to make sure they don’t touch my life again. There’s no grief in it, no softness—just a clean, cold no that keeps repeating.
description_text: {actor} goes unnervingly composed—eyes narrowed, mouth flat, movements economical. Their attention stays locked with a quiet, deliberate hostility, as if any warmth has been professionally withdrawn.

prerequisites.failure_message: Requires hatred to be firmly present (often with contempt or disgust), grounded in strongly negative valence with active engagement and non-collapsed agency. Caps affection/compassion and blocks high guilt to keep it from reading as conflicted remorse. Caps panic/freeze so it doesn’t mislabel fear spirals or immobility. Triggers only on a hatred/contempt rise or hatred crossing to prevent repetition.

alternate_descriptions.auditory: My voice goes flat and precise, like every syllable has been sanded down to remove warmth. I stop wasting words—short answers, clean edges, no invitations.
alternate_descriptions.tactile: The air feels colder around my skin; my hands stay steady, grip firm, as if my body has decided to conserve heat and mercy at the same time.
alternate_descriptions.limited: I withdraw whatever openness I had—expression set, attention narrowed, patience gone.
